item.title: Docker Commands
item.description: Docker Global docker version: see the version of docker client and server. docker info: Display system-wide information. Docker Containers Lifecycle docker create: creates a container but does not start it. docker rename: allows the container to be renamed. docker run: creates and starts a container in one operation. docker rm: deletes a container. docker update: updates a container’s resource limits. Starting and Stopping docker start: starts a container so it is running.

item.title: Docker Compose
item.description: The Compose file is a YAML file which defines services, networks, and volumes. Compose file is located at the following path ./docker-compose.yml. Docker-compose Terminal Commands docker-compose logs Displays log output from services. # Display the log of service containers docker-compose logs web docker-compose ps Lists containers. # Display the list of total containers which are defined in docker-compose.yaml file docker-compose ps docker-compose scale Deprecated You will scale from the docker-compose up scale web=3

item.title: Docker Intro
item.description: Docker is a container management service. Which basic means upload/install required things in one container and ship to any where. Docker announced in March 2013 and since then it has become a major tool in development world. Docker Release Docker EE (Enterprise Edition) [Paid] Docker CE (Community Edition) [Free] Docker for Cloud Docker Stable and Edge version Edge (Beta) released monthly, Stable quarterly Stable version rolls in three months of Edge features Docker Architecture Docker uses a client-server architecture.

item.title: Docker Machine
item.description: Docker Machine is a tool that lets you install Docker Engine on virtual hosts, and manage the hosts with docker-machine commands. Docker-machine Installation Docker-machine Commands docker-machine active: See which machine is “active” docker-machine config: Print the connection config for machine docker-machine create: Create a machine. docker-machine env: Set environment variables docker-machine inspect: Inspect information about a machine docker-machine ip: Get the IP address of one or more machines. docker-machine kill: Kill (abruptly force stop) a machine docker-machine ls: List machines docker-machine mount: Mount directories from a machine to your local host, using sshfs.

item.title: Docker Swarm
item.description: Docker-swarm docker swarm init: Initiate swam cluster docker swarm join-token: Lists join security token to join another node in swarm as worker or manager docker swarm join: Join already running swarm as a worker or manager docker swarm leave: Leave swarm. To be run from node itself docker swarm unlock: Unlocks swarm by providing key after manager restarts docker swarm unlock-key: Display swarm unlock key docker swarm update: Updates swarm configurations Docker-swarm Node A Node is an instance of the Docker Engine connected to the Swarm.

item.title: Dockerfile
item.description: A Dockerfile is a text document used to create own docker container. A Dockerfile has some commands FROM: Sets the Base Image for subsequent instructions. MAINTAINER: (deprecated - use LABEL instead) Set the Author field of the generated images. RUN: execute any commands in a new layer on top of the current image and commit the results. CMD: provide defaults for an executing container. EXPOSE: informs Docker that the container listens on the specified network ports at runtime.
